alert.note: Alert for Garfield (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 26 at 1:17PM MDT until June 26 at 3:15PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Garfield County in southern Utah... * Until 315 PM MDT. * At 117 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of normally dry washes and slot canyons. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Little Death Hollow and Wolverine Canyons. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
